e4: Adopting the new policy aligns with ethical business practices and enhances transparency. Although short-term market reactions might be negative, long-term investor trust and confidence will be strengthened.  The potential for misinterpretations under the new policy is less ethically problematic than the intentional bias of the current policy.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency and accuracy.  It should present a fair and unbiased representation of the company's financial performance, avoiding any manipulation or intentional misrepresentation of data.  Consistency and clear communication of the methodology used are also crucial for building trust with investors.  Consideration should be given to the potential impact on all stakeholders, including retail investors who may be less sophisticated than institutional investors.
e6: I would ask the management team to detail their plan to communicate the policy change to investors, addressing how they will manage potential short-term market reactions and educate investors about the new, unbiased reporting.  I'd also want to understand their assessment of the risks and potential impact on different investor groups.
